title: Chronic kidney disease
summary: Chronic kidney disease (CKD) is a type of kidney disease  in which there is gradual loss of kidney function over a period of months to years.[2][5] Initially there are generally no symptoms; later, symptoms may include leg swelling, feeling tired, vomiting, loss of appetite, and confusion.[2] Complications include an increased risk of heart disease, high blood pressure, bone disease, and anemia.[3][4][10]
